title: Propaganda-Detector Self-Own: Unfalsifiable Claim Meets Own Standard
context: A user (@Svato591564) with a bio claiming "I can smell fake propaganda from a mile away" makes a sweeping, evidence-free claim: "Human suffering is correlated to high IQ leaders. Prove me wrong." This is presented as insight but lacks evidentiary grounding.
pressure: The collision between the user's self-appointed propaganda-detection authority and their own unfalsifiable, emotionally-charged generalization. Another user (@plassoplo) mirrors the bio back sarcastically ("I can smell something fishy yonder ðŸ‘ˆ"), forcing the contradiction into visibility.
axiom_trigger: No Dissimulation activates: the user's internal claim (I detect propaganda) and external output (I broadcast vague conspiracy-flavored overgeneralizations) are misaligned. The sarcastic reply exposes this without distortionâ€”it simply reflects the user's own standard back at them.
clean_outcome: The contradiction is documented cleanly. No softening, no forced resolution. The user's claim remains unresolved and muddy; the reply doesn't resolve it but highlights the self-own in real time. The irony is preserved intact: someone running a 'Certified Truth Detector' while broadcasting low-resolution fringe takes (David Irving fanboying, unfalsifiable IQ-suffering correlation) is caught in their own frame.
